name: Hardest "Archie Comics" Trivia Trivia Quiz | Archie | 25 Questions

questions.text: Archie made his first appearance in which title?
questions.explanation:
"Pep".

	"Pep" #22 in 1941, to be exact.

questions.text: What is Reggie's last name?
questions.explanation: Mantle.

questions.text: What longtime and currently deceased Archie artist created "Josie and the Pussycats"?
questions.explanation:
Dan DeCarlo.

	DeCarlo was fired from Archie Comics after decades of working there, when he sued them for residual payment for any money Josie made the company. I think he thought the movie would do a lot better than it did, since he didn't decide to sue until the film's production was announced.

questions.text: Which of these was never an Archie title?
questions.explanation:
"Archie's Super Cool Jalopy".

	It is believed that Archie has made more appearances in actual comic issues than any other comic book character.

questions.text: Moose was diagnosed with what disorder?
questions.explanation:
Dyslexia.

	A kind of more serious storyline announced Moose's dimness was due to dyslexia.

questions.text: What is the name of Jughead's dog?
questions.explanation:
Hot Dog.

	Archie was the original owner of Hot Dog. How he wound up with Jughead is a mystery.

questions.text: What are the names of Sabrina's aunts?
questions.explanation:
Zelda & Hilda.

	They look a lot better in the TV show starring Melissa Joan Hart than in the comics.

questions.text: What is the name of Riverdale High's newspaper?
questions.explanation:
Blue & Gold.

	Through the years, there have been many different editors of the Blue & Gold, but Betty and Archie have had the most shots at it through the years.

questions.text: Which of these characters is not part of Archie's world and continuum?
questions.explanation:
Lil Jinx.

	Captain Hero is Jughead's alter ego. Even though it's an alternative world, it's part of Archie's.

questions.text: What spy spoof did the gang star in?
questions.explanation:
"The Man From R.I.V.E.R.D.A.L.E."

	Obviously it was a parody of the TV show "The Man from U.N.C.L.E.".

questions.text: What is Dilton's last name?
questions.explanation:
Doiley.

	Notice the trend with Archie characters and the same intitials? Archie Andrews, Jughead Jones, Waldo Weatherbee, Dilton Doiley, Moose Mason, Geraldine Grundy, etc...

questions.text: What is Jughead's real first name?
questions.explanation:
Forsythe.

	His middle initial is P.

questions.text: What did one of the pins on Jughead's hat magically do?
questions.explanation:
made him a girl magnet.

	In the early stories he resisted the attraction, being the girl-hater he was. In later stories, he used the pin to his advantage.

questions.text: What was the name of the publisher before it was called Archie Comics?
questions.explanation:
MLJ.

	After Archie became a success, the named the company after him. Not bad for a teenager with funny red hair and freckles.

questions.text: Who is generally considered the creator of Archie and the gang?
questions.explanation: John Goldwater.

questions.text: What model car did Archie replace his jalopy with?
questions.explanation:
Ford Mustang.

	Archie seems to be behind when it comes to cars. He drove an old jalopy that outdated him by decades and then a 60's Mustang that does the same thing.

questions.text: Chuck Clayton was created to make the comic more ethnically diverse. What is the name of Chuck's girlfriend?
questions.explanation:
Nancy.

	Chuck's dad is Coach Clayton, Riverdale High's coach (along with Coach Kleats).

questions.text: Who is not a supporting character?
questions.explanation: Nurse Honeywells.

questions.text: What company released a very well done Archie trading card set in 1992?
questions.explanation:
Skybox.

	Krome did a nice set, too, in the late 90's.

questions.text: Archie has appeared in comics, cartoons, comic strips, books, and live action TV. Plus they cranked out pop hits. Which of these is not one?
questions.explanation:
"Mish Mash Mosh".

	They didn't have the most original song titles, did they? The Archies, led by Ron Dante, hit #1 in 1969 with "Sugar Sugar". Not bad for a bunch of cartoon characters.

questions.text: Archie's parents are named Fred and Marilyn.
questions.explanation:
False.

	It's Fred and Mary.

questions.text: Veronica played what instrument in "The Archies"?
questions.explanation:
keyboard.

	Archie and Reggie on guitars, Jug on drums, and Betty looked pretty banging a tamborine.

questions.text: Archie had the R on his sweater, what did Jug have on his?
questions.explanation:
S.

	The "R" stood for Riverdale, but who knows what the "S" stood for.

questions.text: Which of these was never an Archie title?
questions.explanation:
"Lazy Lou".

	All three of the right answers were titles outside of the Archie continuum. Pat the Brat followed Lil Jinx's success and Wilbur was a version of Archie. Super Duck? He seemed like a Donald Duck rip-off to me.

questions.text: Who is the science teacher at Riverdale High?
questions.explanation:
Flutesnoot.

	His name is a funny play on his big nose.
